title: About
text:
I am a Vermonter through and through. I grew up in Northern Vermont and got my Bachelor’s of Science in Mathematics at Saint Michael’s College. After graduating, I jumped right into my graduate studies at the University of Vermont in the Mathematical Science Ph.D. program and at the Vermont Complex Systems Center.

When I am not at my laptop or reading papers, you can find me either in the mountains, where I am hiking or skiing, or at a Crossfit class.

title: About Me
text:
I am a Vermonter through and through. I grew up in Northern Vermont and got my Bachelors of Science in Mathematics at the Saint Michael’s College. After graduating, I immediately started my graduate studies at the University of Vermont in the Mathematical Science Ph.D. program and within the Vermont Complex Systems Center.
When I am not at my laptop or reading papers, you can find me either in the mountains, where I am hiking, skiing, or ski patrolling, or at a Crossfit class.

title: Welcome!
text:
I am a fourth year Mathematical Sciences Ph.D. student in the Joint Lab and Computational Story Lab at the Vermont Complex Systems Center at the University of Vermont (UVM). My research has mostly focused on network science applied to biology. This led me in the direction of mathematical methods for networks, specifically stochastic models that involve branching processes.
I am on the job market! Looking to exploring postdoctoral and industry positions. Expected graduation date May 2024.

title: Welcome!
text:
Research Interests

Mathematical models for complex systems
Network science
Stochastic modeling
Disease dynamics

title: Welcome!
text:
Recent News

May 2023: Attended the Women in Network Science Collabathon at the Network Science Institute at Northeastern University.
February 2023: Joint work with Andrea J. Allen, Nicholas J. Roberts, Antoine Allard and Laurent Hebert-Dufresne, Temporal and probabilistic forecast of epidemic interventions is on ArXiv!
